World.headline: $10,000 to $100,000 per person: Trump considers paying Greenlanders to ‘buy’ island for US
World.summary: Former US President Donald Trump is reportedly exploring the possibility of paying Greenland's residents between $10,000 and $100,000 each as part of a potential deal to purchase the island for the United States. This move reflects his continued interest in acquiring Greenland, an idea he previously floated during his presidency. The proposal aims to incentivize the Greenlandic population to support the acquisition.
key_points: Trump considering direct payments to Greenlanders for US acquisition.
Payments could range from $10,000 to $100,000 per person.

World.headline: EAM Jaishankar meets French President Macron; conveys PM Modi’s warm wishes

Health.headline: Britons eat 155 crisp bags' worth of salt every single week, study
